intro: Freziera forerorum, commonly known as the mountain snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, often in rocky or alpine environments. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to cold and arid conditions. Freziera forerorum produces white or pale blue flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
